history.text: Hello, how are you?
Great. How are you today?
Doing fine over here! Hey, have you seen The Shape of Water?
I havent. I've wanted to see it. I have a few friends that have watched it and they liked it.
What about you?
I have, and let me tell you are missing something really good! What have you heard about it?

ACtually I have watched this. Its a great movie. I love movies set in the 1960's. It gives me a nostalgic feeling. I like any movies dealing with sci fi type stuff. There is nothing short of that in this film.
What do you like the most about it?
The ending when the creature kills strickland.
Do you know there's a theory where Strickland is left alive and mute because of his injuries?
I didn't. What did you think of Elisa as a character?
It's great, I think. It's a rare character and that makes her ideal to become so attached to a creature that's also rare
And what about Sally Hawins performance?
Yes. I agree. She did a wonderful job. I couldnt imagine growing up at that period completely deaf to the outside world.
Yeah, it's amazing. And what is your favorite scene?
When Elisa discovers the creature it was pretty amazing. I couldnt imagine what she was thinking at that point.
Agreed. But don't you think the movie maybe lacked a scene more or two where we can perceive the creature's intelligence?
Yes. I do. I was curious as to what it was actually processing most of the movie. What do you think was going through the creatures mind when Elisa first took it to her home?
Are you still with me?
He must have felt appreciated, but also a bit underwhelmed that they aren't releasing him to the world, but rather having him in a secluded  bathroom
I have to ask. If you were in that situation do you think you wouldve went all the way with the creature? As in have sex with it?
I think not. And I think for the most part it's because we are not conscious of how intelligent the creature is. Is it having sex because he's falling in love? Is it just animal instincts?

Yea that I don't know. Definitely a gross scene to me. I couldn't
 imagine that haha.
What did you think of Strickland? Di you hate his character or was he just a guy doing his job?
Hahaha, well they didn't make as gross as it could be, but it definitely was very "WTF?"

Strickland was a great character. He's just a cynic and outcome-centric man. He's not there to think about the creature itself, but of how the creature can contribute in the winning of the cold war. He isn't even that focused on it, but more on achieving what's expected of him.
Did you like his character?
Yeah. You feel for the guy because he is ultimately a military man. Hes doing what training has told him to do.
Exactly! He's willing to go as far as he needs to go to fulfill his duty
Is there any criticism you have for the movie?
The sex scene was probably the biggest turnoff for me. Other than that it was really well done.
Yeah, that went too far. It might have been better if it was insinuated rather than shown
I agree on that part.
Did you like the ending?

uid2response.feedback: We have both watched the movie, so we talked about it rather than convince one or the other to watch it
